result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J Marshall III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Thomas J Marshall III was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thomas J Marshall III is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Thomas J Marshall III was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Thomas J Marshall III was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Thomas J Marshall III was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Thomas J Marshall III was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Thomas J Marshall III was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1g.
  • Thomas J Marshall III was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) AMENDED FROM Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Thomas J Marshall III was found guilty of Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Thomas J Marshall III was found guilty of Possession of Firearm by Felon [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • Thomas J Marshall III was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety AMENDED FROM 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Thomas J Marshall III was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety AMENDED FROM 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Thomas J Marshall III was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety AMENDED FROM 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 12 years bifurcated sentence.
*MODIFIED 4-5-18: Length of sentence*

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with co defendants.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Firearm warning given.   Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

granting admissibility of the DVD's generated by the Racine Police Department for certain drug transactions.

Defendant Thomas J Marshall in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Thomas J Marshall in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State noted a number of errors in the information and based upon that, there was an amended information prepared. Defense objects to amended info being filed. BTC: The Court will allow the amendment.
State files amended information. Defense acknowledges receipt/waives reading of same; NG plea entered. The State has received the order of the Court regarding the decision. Due to the sensitive nature of the content of the police reports provided to defense, the State asks that the deft not be given copies. BTC: There is to be NO redistribution of the information nor will the defendant have a physical copy.
There are no discovery issues by either party. The State and Defense are given leave by the Court to extend time for parties to bring MIL that can be heard prior to voir dire. All witnesses are served and ready for trial for both parties. 1 alternate, 5 strikes. Trial is expected to last 3 full days.  Defense objects to the use of DVD's

BTC: JT remains. The Court does not view the DVD's as testimonial evidence and therefore will allow their use with the proviso of the State. The State is to prepare an order.

Defendant Thomas J Marshall in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Thomas J Marshall in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Ms. Kuehn indicates deft is willing to waive his speedy trial for 9/15 and then reasserts speedy trial on today's date. The State has concerns with regards to deft reasserting DST and being able to get trial in during the statutory time limits.

Defense now indicates that deft is willing to waive speedy trial and will not reassert the same. The Court conducts colloquy with defendant regarding waiving speedy trial.

BTC: The Court denies motion to adj speedy trial. Speedy trial remains as scheduled. Upon further review of other information, the matter may be removed from JT calendar and speedy trial may NOT be reasserted. The Court accepts the defendant waiving his right to speedy trial  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Preliminary hearing on February 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the co-defendants, TM, CQ and AW.    Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.
